content.text: table is a base table in a Microsoft SQL Server database, designed to store information about different subtypes of energy delivery. Each record in this table represents a specific subtype, identified by a unique
. The table is linked to the

table through a foreign key relationship, indicating that each subtype is associated with a broader energy delivery type. The table also includes metadata such as whether the subtype is the default option and the date it was added to the system.
The complexity level of this table is considered medium due to the following factors:
It involves a foreign key relationship, which adds a layer of complexity in terms of data integrity and referential constraints.
The table includes a default constraint and a primary key, which are standard but require careful management.
The presence of a clustered primary key index affects how data is physically stored and accessed.
, which is an integer and ensures the uniqueness of each record. It is also the clustered index, meaning the data is physically sorted by this column.
column is a foreign key referencing the
table. This establishes a relationship between energy delivery subtypes and their parent types.
: A varchar(250) column that stores the name of the subtype. It is not nullable, ensuring that every subtype has a name.
: A bit column indicating whether the subtype is the default option. It has a default value of 0 (false).
: A datetime column that records when the subtype was added, ensuring a timestamp for each entry.
table is likely used in scenarios where energy delivery needs to be categorized into more granular subtypes for billing, reporting, or operational purposes. Use cases include:
Generating detailed billing reports that require subtype categorization.
Configuring system defaults for energy delivery options.
Analyzing energy delivery trends by subtype over time.
